thread.title: Flores scores in 82nd minute, Costa Rica ties Haiti 1-1
thread.title_full: Flores scores in 82nd minute, Costa Rica ties Haiti 1-1

title: Flores scores in 82nd minute, Costa Rica ties Haiti 1-1
text:
Close Image 1 of 3 
Haiti forward Christiano Francois, left, works the ball down the pitch as Costa Rica midfielder Dylan Flores pursues during the first half of a CONCACAF men's olympic qualifying soccer match Wednesday, Oct. 7, 2015, in Commerce City, Colo. Photo: David Zalubowski, AP Haiti forward Christiano Francois, left, works the ball down the... Image 2 of 3 
Haiti midfielder Zachary Herivaux, center, takes a shot between Costa Rica midfielder Christian Martinez, left, and defender Julio Cascante during the first half of a CONCACAF Olympic qualifying soccer match Wednesday, Oct. 7, 2015, in Commerce City, Colo. Photo: David Zalubowski, AP Haiti midfielder Zachary Herivaux, center, takes a shot between... Image 3 of 3 
Haiti forward Jonel Desire, center, looks on as his shot is blocked by Costa Rica defender Julio Cascante, right, while midfielder Allan Cruz covers during the first half of a CONCACAF Olympic qualifying soccer match Wednesday, Oct. 7, 2015, in Commerce City, Colo. Photo: David Zalubowski, AP Haiti forward Jonel Desire, center, looks on as his shot is blocked... Flores scores in 82nd minute, Costa Rica ties Haiti 1-1 1 / 3 Back to Gallery COMMERCE CITY, Colo. (AP) â€” Dylan Flores scored in the 82nd minute and Costa Rica tied Haiti 1-1 on Wednesday night in their Group B finale in the CONCACAF Olympic qualifying tournament. Costa Rica and Haiti both lost to Honduras and Mexico in the opening games in Carson, California. Flores lined a shot from just outside the penalty box that goaltender Luis Odelus had no chance of stopping. Pierre Paulson gave Haiti the lead in the 51st minute on a free kick from in close. He lined the ball into the left corner of the goal. Haiti had a chance to win in injury time on a corner kick, but couldn't knock in a loose ball in the box. Most Popular
